Detailed Description

Buffered object.

Derive from this class to implement functions required by a Buffer. The Buffer reads and writes data to/from the buffered object through this interface.

Member Function Documentation

virtual int BufferedProxy::BufferedObject::Read ( unsigned  handle,
char *  pBuffer,
int  n 
)
pure virtual

Reads n bytes of data from handle to the buffer starting at pBuffer. Returns the number of blocks read.

Parameters
handleHandle provided to the Buffer.
pBufferLocation to put the data.
nNumber of blocks to read.
Returns
Number of bytes actually read – must be a multiple of the block size
Note
handle's "current location" is expected to move to the next byte following the data that was copied to the buffer.
n is always a multiple of the block size.
pBuffer is always aligned to the buffer alignment.
virtual int BufferedProxy::BufferedObject::Seek ( unsigned  handle,
int  location 
)
pure virtual

Sets handle's "current location" to the given location. Returns the resulting location.

Parameters
handleHandle provided to the Buffer.
locationWhere to put the "current location" (which block).
Returns
Resulting block location, or < 0 if there was an error.
Note
The data in the buffered object is assumed to start at 0.
virtual int BufferedProxy::BufferedObject::Write ( unsigned  handle,
char const *  pBuffer,
int  n 
)
pure virtual

Writes n bytes of data from the buffer starting at pBuffer to handle. Returns the number of blocks written.

Parameters
handleHandle provided to the Buffer.
pBufferLocation to put the data.
nNumber of blocks to write.
Returns
Number of bytes actually written – must be a multiple of the block size
Note
handle's "current location" is expected to move to the next byte following the data that was copied from the buffer.
pBuffer is always aligned to the buffer alignment.
